bug.author: numpee
bug.summary: Segmentation mask logging issue in wandb.Image
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname Wandb version: 0.9.2 Python version: 3.5.2 OS: Linux
Weights and Biases version: 0.9.2 Python version: 3.5.2 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
There is a bug in the segmentation mask logging code. Specifically, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/blob/master/wandb/data_types.py#L1264>here</denchmark-link> . The code is supposed to validate whether mask is a numpy integer array, but it calls , while is a dictionary. I believe it should be ? <denchmark-h:h3>Edit</denchmark-h>
I've changed this line in my local wandb source code, and it seems to be working now. Hopefully you'll fix this bug in the next version üòÑ
